Comments_List: I learned how to think in french. I also learned the basic techniques for conversation.
I have developed some skills in forming some basic tenses in French and have become more confident in forming short sentences and using different grammar rules.
I think they should incorporate  more english into the class to help understand more.

I appreciated the rigor of the course. However, I found that is had a disproportionate focus on a video and in that did not address the students interest in learning utilize the language. While it seems valuable to have content from the video, this should be reduced to allow the students to interact more with the language itself

I quite liked the way the course was laid out with the frequent tests which helped me to keep up with the content.  I think the immersion aspect of the course is good as it gets you used to hearing French. But for learning some of the more complex grammar rules I think it would have been useful to switch for English for just a small section of the class to avoid lots of confusion.
I think so yes. Though it was hard, I learned quite a bit about the french language.
I would recommend this course as it really does throw you straight into French and even though it is a lot of work it does teach you a lot in a short space of time.
